page.title: 03ENTERAINMENT IN DONCASTER
page.content: IN DONCASTER THERE ARE THREE NIGHT CLUBS WHICH WE VISITED. THEY ARE "MAINLINE", "ROTTERS" AND "SEVENTH HEAVEN". "SEVENTH HEAVEN" IS A TYPICAL EXAMPLE AND IS SO CALLED FROM THE EXPRESSION "IN THE SEVENTH HEAVEN" MEANING ECSTATIC. THE BUILDING INCLUDES A MAIN ROOM AND A SMALLER ONE CALLED "CLOUDS" WHICH IS ALSO THE NAME OF THE OWNER'S DOG. THIRTY YEARS AGO THE ESTABLISHMENT WAS THE CO-OP BALLROOM. WHEN IT CHANGED HANDS TWO BARS WERE BUILT WHICH WERE REVOLUTIONARY AT THE TIME. THE COST OF DECORATING AND CONVERSION IN 1984 WAS Â£550,000. SATURDAY IS THE BUSIEST NIGHT OF THE WEEK BECAUSE CLIENTS DO NOT HAVE TO GET UP FOR WORK THE NEXT MORNING. THE MOST POPULAR DRINKS ARE LAGER AND BEER BUT BY LAW FOOD HAS TO BE SOLD AS WELL
